title.rendered: Find Rooms For Rent In Cape Cod

content.rendered:
If quaint villages, seafood shacks, lighthouses, ponds, bay and ocean beaches pique your interest then you’ve come to the right place! Cape Cod, a hook-shaped peninsula of the U.S. state of Massachusetts, is a popular summertime destination. But what if this summertime vacation could be 365 days? Amazing, right! We’ll help you find cheap rooms for rent in Cape Cod and help you live your best life. If you are looking to cut through the chase and live in the most desirable places on Cape Cod, this is your guide.

Getting to know Cape Cod

Cape Cod is a geographic cape extending into the Atlantic Ocean from the southeastern corner of mainland Massachusetts. This island has beaches, marshlands, sand dunes, rivers, and vineyards. What more could you ask for? Let’s see the top neighborhoods, activities and average rent in Cape Cod, so you can make an informed decision.

Finding rooms for rent in Cape Cod

A common misconception people have is that Cape Cod is too expensive to move to. But living in the Cape can be affordable as long as you avoid prime areas—it’s a location that can cater to every lifestyle. So whether you’re planning on becoming a Cape Cod resident or you’re just dreaming about moving there, here’s what living in Cape Cod is like. It’s useful to know that if you’re looking for cheap rooms for rent in Cape Cod, one-bedroom efficiency apartments can be a great choice.

Find Rooms for Rent in Cape Cod

Top Neighborhoods in Cape Cod

Cape Cod spans the whole of Barnstable County and has 15 towns. To make it easier to remember where everything is, Cape Cod is split into four different sections: Upper Cape, Mid-Cape, Outer Cape, and Lower Cape. But before looking further at cheap rooms and average rent in Cape Cod, let’s look into the best neighborhoods to live in!

  • Sandwich: It has a cute little village area, some nice restaurants, great beaches, the canal for walking and bike riding. Not only is Sandwich the safest town but also the oldest in Cape Cod being incorporated in 1639. The overall crime rate in this town is 1.11%, making it the safest neighbourhood to find rooms for rent in Cape Cod.
  • Brewster: There is no shortage of inns and B&B’s in Brewster. Home of the Captain Freeman Inn and Crosby Mansion this town takes silver with a crime percentage of 1.34%. Perfect location to look for cheap rooms for rent in Cape Cod.
  • Harwich: This neighborhood is most well-known for its cranberry bogs and the annual Harwich Cranberry Festival. It’s suitable for youngsters looking to experience the culture, while living in rooms for rent in Cape Cod.

Average rent in Cape Cod

University life in Cape Cod

Besides the laid-back lifestyle, beaches add a lot of color the the student life in Cape Cod. Moreover, universities provide opportunities to connect, and become involved in the campus community through a variety of recreational programs. Here are the top 5 universities in and around Cape Cod:

  • Bridgewater State University Cape Cod
  • Anna Maria College
  • Suffolk University
  • Bryant University
  • Cape Cod Community College

Average Cost Of Living In Cape Cod

How transit-friendly is Cape Cod?

1. Ferries

Bay State Cruise Company and Boston Harbor Cruises offer seasonal, high-speed ferry service between Boston and Provincetown. While the Woods Hole to Martha’s Vineyard ferry can accommodate cars, there’s no need to take a car. Both islands have excellent public transportation service, so take your bicycle instead!

2. Airports in Cape Cod

Cape Cod thrives on tourism, so there’s no surprise that it has excellent airports for travel. Some of the airports in Cape Cod are:

  • Martha’s Vineyard Airport (MVY)
  • Nantucket Memorial Airport (ACK)
  • Barnstable Airport (HYA)

Extensive inter-town public bus system makes frequent stops at the MVY airport. Moreover, regularly scheduled daily flights connect from Boston to Hyannis and Boston to Provincetown.

3. Trails and bike paths

Cape Cod National Seashore and the surrounding communities have many miles of paved and unpaved hiking trails and bike paths available. While the Cape is separated from the rest of the state by a narrow body of water, this stretch of land is easily accessible from Boston and Providence thanks to canal bridges.

4. Buses

If you don’t want to drive in Cape Cod, there are public transit options available. Sit back and relax on one of the Cape’s buses. Some buses can take you around the Cape, while other buses connect Cape Cod to Boston, Brockton, and Providence.

Related: Find Rooms For Rent In Milwaukee

Traditional Architecture in Cape Cod

Generally, Cape Cod homes have a steep roof, shingled exterior, symmetrical façade, and large chimney in the middle. While these houses can have multiple floors, most residences are single-storied. Additionally, Cape Cod house style is notoriously free of any excessive decoration, making them versatile enough for a variety of homeowners.

Nowadays, Cape Cod house style falls into one of three categories: a full Cape, three-quarter Cape, and half Cape. While full Cape houses boast a picture-perfect symmetry that is commonly associated with the style, three-quarter and half Capes are smaller, not to mention their entryways and chimneys are slightly offset.

Outdoor activities in Cape Cod

Cape Cod has many beautiful and pristine landscapes, so it’s an ideal setting if you like to explore off the beaten track. The weather is relatively warm for much of the year—well, warm by New England standards. This means you can spend more days outdoors, taking in the scenery.

There are hikes to be taken, and bike trails to cycle. If you’re feeling adventurous, go for a swim. While Atlantic cod aren’t as plentiful as they used to be on Cape Cod, there is still a variety of fish to catch. Buy or rent fishing gear and enjoy a peaceful afternoon out on the water. Kayaking opportunities abound, and kayak rental companies are spread out all over the Cape.

Sailing and boat trips are also available around the Cape, and if you’re lucky, you might even spot the occasional whale.

One of the most magical times in Cape Cod is in September. All of the tourists have gone back to work or school, and you can enjoy everything the Cape has to offer without the crowds. Residents take to the local restaurants, walk the now-quiet beaches, and remember why they chose to live in Cape Cod in the first place.

Living in Cape Cod is a dream that can be made a reality. The laid-back lifestyle, sweeping beaches, and lush landscapes make the Cape a paradise to live in. So what are you waiting for, look for rooms for rent in Cape Cod, now!

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find cheap rooms for rent in Cape Cod? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match! Download the app here and hop on the easiest ride home, ever!
